page.title: 01A PATCH OF RURAL NORTH WILTS
page.content: This is a quiet peaceful patch of north Wiltshire lying just south of the water-filled gravel pits of the Cotswold Water Park, and the infant Thames. To the north are the villages of Ashton Keynes and the Leigh (pronounced Lie), part of which extends into the block. To the west is the village of Minety, to the south- west the town of Purton and to the north-east the town of Cricklade. The land is fairly flat and almost entirely used to rear dairy and beef cattle. It is crossed by two minor roads and the railway line from Swindon to Gloucester which has no nearby halt. The block contains an old people's home, one shop incorporating a sub-post office, one public house and a Methodist Chapel which is served by visiting clergy.
